title: NY on top
text: Beautiful hotel very trendy great location for non-touristy New York all around you can visit a lot of an important number of tourist places museum restaurants new places for visitors. super equipped hotel with super fashionable nightclub, high cost but all of NY is very expensive

title: A lovely stay, will be back.
text: The hotel is clean, well located in the meatpacking district. The staff are friendly and welcoming. The fitness room is great. The bathroom was a good size and the toiletries are high quality. They provide a hair straightener and the diffusers for the hairdryer. A nice touch. The robes and slippers are also a nice touch. The desk chair was comfortable for my husband to work at.  My only quibble was no coffee in the room.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text:
This hotel is amazing from top to bottom.  
Understated class. 
The bed and pillows were so comfortable. 
Would suggest the deluxe room that has a small sitting area. 
The location couldn’t be better. Walking distance to many restaurants, The Whitney, Chelsea Market and the Hudson River. 
Staff goes above and beyond!
A bit pricey but WELL worth it!
Second time staying here- can’t wait to return.

title: Sets it self apart: great vibes, superb location.
text:
This is our hotel if we go to New York, class above the rest. Great location in the meatpacking district and walking easy to West village, Chelsea and Greenwich.
Not too big, not many tourists: classy and interesting people. The Team is great and you will feel at home soon, all decorated with modern art, nice rooms and great atmosphere: try to rooftop bar and pool.

title: Wonderful Hotel in great neighborhood
text:
The room was wonderful ; location great ; area nice ; hotel staff top notch !!

Spacious room for New York Hotel 

Well furnished. Gym was great 

Easy access with wide streets

We will stay again 

Nice coffee shop in lobby .
Very well staffed and cooks lot be nicer

title: Underwhelming
text:
Given the brand - and all the reviews  - I thought we'd be stepping into the swankiest, luxe hotel possibly ever! Eh. I've seen nicer lobbies in bus stations. Well, I don't actually go to bus stations, so that's not true. But it's what I'd imagine a bus station lobby might look like, with a little cafe crammed into the corner, and a couple sad little chairs insufficient for the 15 people waiting around because some technical glitch was holding up things at the front desk... 

I will say that poor staff, struggling mightily through who knows what was going on, were all troupers (this is how you spell it, people!), dealing with cranky guests with grace and best efforts. And the valets and bellman were unfailingly friendly and helpful throughout our stay. Very welcoming.

Rooms are nice - the window seat is a charming touch, though if your neighbors are sitting in theirs... hi?! 

For what you're paying, though, things should be a little nicer - street- and neighboring room-noise (including a barking dog) got annoying at times. And why is there no coffee maker in the room? I can't be the only person who would like a cup of coffee - even a mediocre one - before having to get dressed to go get one. Our sink was clogged (though fixed quickly), but that's kinda gross, and inconvenient for us to schedule its repair. 

Location was great (well, other than the robbery at Gucci across the street) with everything the Village and Chelsea have to offer within a few minute's walk. All in all, not what I was expecting, but not terrible. If half star ratings were possible, I'd give it a 3.5 for the price.

title: Modern hotel
text: Modern, clean hotel. Loved meat packing district. Friendly staff. Always had security at front door and elevator. Would stay again. Next to Google office and Chelsea Market. King size beds. No problems at all. Easy subway access. Away from tourist trap of Tomes Square.

title: Very disappointed
text:
We are currently at the hotel but have had so many issues I felt I should document now.

Thoroughly disappointed with our experience since arriving last night. This morning I requested the manger contact me on arrival, just followed this up and the message to contact me didn’t reach her !

So here goes

1, on arrival we were told there was an IT issue so guests were unable to have keys for their rooms but security would need to let you in everytime you wanted access. What was more shocking was that the security men told me this has been the case for 2 weeks now !!

2, we had requested a room with 2 beds. They hadn’t seen this, and I was told sue to the “IT” issue they could not move us to the correct room.

3, I had selected this hotel (never again) due to rooftop bar, pool and restaurant. On arrival we were told it was closed till Wednesday (when we leave). 

4, food in the restaurant Chester’s was poor. I ordered roast chicken with “vegetables”, I received Roast chicken on a bed of carrots. To be fair they did not charge us.

5, manager was pleasant but did not feel she did enough to placate us die this disappointing experience.

This place is certainly not in the league of best hotels in New York like they were when based on Park Avenue.

title: Not My First nor Last Stay
text:
Gansevoort Meatpacking is located in one of the hottest spots in NYC, so definitely it is always my first choice. Besides the location, the spacious rooms, the cleanliness and the staff will always make it my first choice. The staff is very friendly and professional. Also, the food is delicious. Thank you  Gansevoort Team for absolutely everything. 

Nour

title: So Much Going For It.
text:
The Gansevoort is a swanky landmark hotel stuffed in the Meatpacking District of NYC. My Deluxe King room was appreciated with its sofa bed and bay window and collage of walnut crescenda, desk and armoire. The desk chair popped in blue, a floating shelf perched over the tv, a backlight headboard graced the bed and the room was outfitted with high-tech room appliances. The bath was accessed via a decorative barn door, subway tiled and adorned with black matte hardware. Culinary offerings include 2 ground floor restaurants. On one side of the main entrance is the Chester.........a Bistro, and bustling spot for American bites and cocktails. On the other side is the European-inspired Coffee + Cocktails serving up Mediterranean delights. Tucked away in a corner of the Rooftop Lounge is the Saishin omakase venue that highlights traditional Japanese cuisine like Hamachi, Madai, Akami and more.......I selected the King Salmon....very flavorful. The 45 foot long rooftop pool is the hotel's most distinctive asset and sports an indoor & outdoor portion and a Scandinavian look brought to life by night lighting. So, if you seek an urban retreat with destination dining, a sleek Rooftop Lounge and a shopping & attractions mecca....then try the......
...............Gansevoort Meatpacking NYC................so much going for it.

title: The coolest spot in town
text:
The hotel is in an excellent location with a wonderful restaurant. We enjoyed a martini in the bar by the lobby before heading out and loved our bartender.
Staff was hospitable and went above and beyond to make sure we enjoyed our stay. Made us feel like true VIPs! I can't wait to go back

title: Premier NYC hotel
text:
The Gansevoort Hotel occupies the upper echelon of Manhattan’s many boutique hotels. It’s located at the junction of the West Village/Meatpacking/Chelsea neighborhoods. We have visited NYC dozens of times and have easily concluded this hotel has them all beat. It has the perfect blend of unpretentious luxury and style with a rock-star staff. This, our fifth stay,  was made special by Gabriella their assistant manager who meticulously planned a special birthday celebration. Available to answer any questions we had, even on her days off! How’s that for service?
This hotel is the complete package where everyone from the housekeeping staff to the hotel owner strives to make you feel welcome.

title: The Gansevroot Hotel is outstanding: the accommodations, service, staff, location and amenities!!
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Gansevroot Hotel/Meatpacking district in NYC! Our stay was expertly coordinated by Lauren Nordstrom, Manager of Front Office and Front Desk Operations. She selected an excellent suite with beautiful views of NYC, and arranged for a surprise plate of delicious homemade chocolates that made our stay that much “sweeter!” Upon arrival we were greeted with a very warm welcome by Marcel who immediately recognized us from our previous stay 11 months before!! We were so pleasantly surprised!! Raul was immediate in his attention to greet us too, and efficiently collected our bags while we checked-in with the two Front Desk Agents, Nikole & Precious, both professional and  very pleasant!! Raul escorted us to our room and thoughtfully & strategically placed all our bags in perfect locations for ease of unpacking!! Later in the evening we invited 4  friends to join us at the beautifully renovated Gansevroot Rooftop Bar where we were greeted by a lovely hostess who seated us at the perfect table for our group!Immediately we were approached by a very tall, lean, and very friendly cocktail waiter who was extremely attentive to our table and provided the best service we have ever experienced in any bar setting!! (Especially since we were an “older” group of people, lol!)  At the end of our excellent stay at the The Gansevroot, we were greeted by the Front Desk Agent  Michael who was genuinely interested in our overall satisfaction with our accommodations and our stay!! He was eager to pass along our remarks to his managers!! We were very well cared for and we enjoyed the amenities of the hotel: impressively new and improved, workout center, the heated, outdoor rooftop pool, coffee shop and we look forward to the restaurants on our next visit!!

title: Great to stay in cool area
text: Nice hotel in good location with lots around it. Quieter but cooler area to stay vs. midtown.   Close to Google and other local businesses as well as Chelsea Market and the Highline.   Note that there are bars and restaurants downstairs so it can be noisy sometimes.

title: NYE with Gansevoort
text:
Greta hotel in a great area. Having stayed in Times Square the previous 4 nights it was great to get out to a quieter area that was full of character. 

The deluxe queen rooms were spacious and modern and we booked two nights to attend the rooftop NYE event. The host Gabriella was an absolute legend, she assist with our booking whilst we were overseas and was there on the night to ensure we had an amazing time and were looked after.

The crowd was great and the drinks were flowing. We’d probably pre order less food and more bottles if we were doing it again but it all worked out and we had a great night!

We will be back for sure 👌

title: Lindo hotel en Meatpacking District
text: La ubicación fuera del bullicio de Midtown me parece la mejor. Rodeada de muchas tiendas lindas y deliciosos restaurantes. El servicio es muy bueno, con gente muy amable y servicial. Las vistas al río a la hora del sunset son estupendas. Sin duda me volvería a hospedar

title: Great Option in Lower Manhattan
text: We stayed at the Ganesvoort for two nights for a quick Christmas in NY trip.   The location and the room were the stars of the hotel.  We reserved a Grand Deluxe King and it was a beautiful and recently renovated room.   It was large by NY standards, quiet, and comfortable.  The hotel is in the heart of the meatpacking district and you could not ask for a better location to explore the bottom half of Manhattan.    We did do a broadway show and visited the Christmas sites in and around Rockefeller Center and it was an easy subway ride with the station a block away.   There is a rooftop bar which we did not visit.  The lobby bar and restaurant were both pretty average and not worth visiting in a city with so many great options close by.    We drove and valet parking was about what we expected…ridiculously expensive at $85, but that’s sort of the going rate to park a car for 24 hours in the city.    Finally the service level was fine, but not up to the rest of the hotel.  Nothing tragic, but oddly a lack of pro activity.  Both checking in and checking out we were struggling with our luggage and the doorman and the valet sort of stood by and watched.   Again, not tragic, but not up to what you’d expect from a high end NYC hotel.   I rated it 4, but would have given it 4.5 stars if permitted.   I’d definitely consider going back again.

title: Not worth the money
text: It is a clean hotel but nothing special. Certainly is not value for money, it is expensive for being ordinary. There is no lounge to relax in, we were asked to leave the bar area because of a private function, where are guests expected to go! We had to pay $8 for a litre of water. Will not be returning nor recommending.

title: Great hotel with prompt service
text: I stayed at this hotel for 20 nights and it was great. I'm a former New Yorker, and needed a hotel for an extended stay due to the new Air B & B laws in New York. The staff was the highlight! Especially Marcel and John Ross: they made a long trip seamless. The reception desk, housekeeping, restaurant and room service were also very helpful and prompt. I'll return! Thanks Again!

title: Top location, great people and the right place to be ( especally for german friends!
text:
We enjoyed a marvellos  time at a outstanding place. Great roof top pool, exzellent view, outstanding restaurant and —- really important warm and dedicates service personell ( mainlyGabriela Hurst!,)
Coming back to N Y - this would be our place to stay!

My firm hosted an event on the rooftop last week and it was absolutely wonderful!! Gabriella was incredible to work with- we decided to do our event very last minute and she managed to make it perfect on such short notice. The space is gorgeous and the staff was great! We will definitely host another event here!

title: I would definitely put this on my list of "hotels to return to"!
text: Awesome location for our needs and good sized rooms.  Bathroom was also roomy and clean.  We had a great view of the Hudson River, which we didn't expect. Another positive was that we were able to walk from Moynahan Station, which is not something everyone will want to do, but it is a nice walk if you want some fresh air after a train ride!  The only downside was that I have been unable to retrieve a couple of articles of clothing which I left behind.  I called less than 24 hours after check out and told the staff my room number and exactly where the clothes were and they said they didn't find anything in the room.  That does not leave the best taste in my mouth.  Obviously my mistake, but I would like to think people are honest enough to turn in items which guests might leave behind.

title: Location, location, location
text:
This is a solid 4-star hotel and I would definitely stay here again due to the pros.

Pros: Location, Location, Location; plus Clean, Free Wifi, Staff is friendly and good. 

Cons: Soft mattresses and lumpy pillows; no 24-hr room service and food choices are not edible, including terrible wait staffs in both eating spots; room temperature can't be self regulated; exterior noise at hotel is loud 24-hours a day; furnishings felt low level for a pricey hotel like this.

title: Great Experience
text: Great location and great hotel.  Friendly and attentive service.  We had a birthday celebration on the roof top for 20 people which was great.   Gabby from the event planning staff was fantastic at coordinating everything.  We will be back.

title: Thank you Gabriella & the Gansevoort.
text: Our organisation hosted a semi-private event on the Gansevoort Rooftop, and it was flawless. Our point of contact was Gabriella, and she truly went above and beyond for our organisation; she was incredibly responsive and professional and tailored the event to just how we imagined it. On the evening, Nino was incredibly hospitable and we are grateful to our wonderful host Sprok. What a setting, and service! Thank you, Gabriella, we will be requesting your service each time!

title: Gansevoort NYC decides to grow up.
text:
I am going to be honest, I reserved the Gansevoort with some trepidation. 20 years ago the Meatpacking district became a nightclub Mecca in New York. Alot of hotels opened to capture the crowds. As I always say ,hotels catering to the party crowd always take a beating, and loose their luster very quickly. Gansevoort was one of those hotels , along with the likes of the Dream Downtown, Soho House, The Standard, etc.  The issue is when I travel to NYC , the Meatpacking district is my base, so when I heard the Gansevoort had gone through a renovation, I jumped at the chance to actually stay in the Meatpacking district. 
I was not expecting much , as the Gansevoort hotels have been closing. However, I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel has managed to exceed its original luster, while attracting  a more mature client base, reflecting the maturity of the Meatpacking district as well. Obviously I don't look for the same things in a hotel as I did 20 years ago. I am happy there is a hotel now in the area that decided to grow with me and the times.

title: Not a luxury hotel.
text:
A fancy hotel in an upscale neighborhood with no heat (not tuned on yet),  horrible construction noise from 7am at nearby building. No fans in bathroom. No ceiling light made room dark. $8 Waterbottles set next to bed...
Bathroom door is a slider that wouldn't stay shut nor lock. Minimal lobby space.  
Nice staff. 
Gorgeous rooftop pool with views of the river and lots of seating for sunbathing.  Cozy rooftop bar with separate (and quieter) group area.

title: Een aanrader
text:
Dit hotel is in het voor NY rustig gelegen meatpacking district ons favoriete gedeelte van Manhattan vanwege de laagbouw en minder hectisch dorpse gevoel.
Ook zijn er veel goed restaurants te vinden.
Het is dicht bij verschillende bezienswaardigheden. 
Wij vonden de nieuw ingerichte lobby iets minder mooi dan vroeger maar dat is smaak kwestie.
Het personeel is vriendelijk en behulpzaam.
De kamers zijn redelijk van formaat en het is fijn dat een raam open kan.
We hebben dan ook met raam open geslapen omdat het zo rustig was s’avonds.

title: Absolutely love this hotel, location and the excellent staff at reception, lobby bar and the doormen.
text: My first time not staying in Mid-Town and I will never go back, thanks' much to the great location of this hotel, the surrounding amenities, restaurants coupled with the excellent service in the hotel itself. Lively lobby bar with even a trio playing jazz was a great option. A surprisingly in-depth menu there. How they manage the area is to be commended, they always found me a spot. I cant wait to return.

title: An oasis in Manhattan
text:
The Gansevoort could not be better located if you want to explore the best of the Village, Highline, and Chelsea.  It's a newer building with all the amenities:  pool, rooftop bar, restaurants, outdoor cafe, etc., etc.  The staff is also extremely friendly and welcoming.  We only stayed two nights, but it quickly felt like home.

My only gripe is the price.  Our room ended up, after taxes, a few breakfast/drink charges, etc., over $800 per night.  I realize this is true of EVERY hotel in New York now, but it prompted us to shorten our 3-day weekend to 2.  Money truly seems to evaporate when you are in Manhattan.

The hotel has a perfect vibe that is hip/urban but also down-to-earth and friendly.  We'll return definitely.

title: Recommend Rooftop for Work Happy Hour
text: I took my team out for happy hour and worked with Gabriella Hurst to plan this casual gathering. She was excellent to work with, very responsive and so accommodating! If you have a group over 8, I highly recommend asking for her assistance and choosing Gansevoort Meatpacking!

title: Kindness Counts
text: My daughter and I had a great stay at the Gansevoort.  Our 2 bedroom suite was small but clean and cool and had everything we needed. The location is great for shopping, and is far from the more tourist parts of the city.  My daughter is allergic to a lot - and the manager was kind enough to purchase a small air cleaner for the room - and it made a big difference. Two thumbs up.

title: Excellent Behind-the-Scenes Service
text: This is a review for those people who do the hard yards behind the scenes!  I was having a tremendous amount of difficulty getting an extremely important package to a client staying at the Gansevoort NYC.  Rene from Guest Services went above and beyond to help me with UPS and when it finally arrived, he went out of his way to rush it to my client, essentially saving our team a lot of problems.  He was friendly and professional from the moment he picked up the phone and managed to put me at ease, as I felt confident that he had my back.  Thank you, Rene!  And thank you to the charming Gabriella Hurst who also assisted me later in the week.  What a team!  I will DEFINITELY be staying with you the next time I visit NYC.

title: Hospitalidade ZERO
text:
Serviço bizarro no rooftop, piscina e bar do lobby.
Desrespeitoso, ganancioso e zero hospitaleiro. Se você considerar que o hotel é o valor de um hotel de luxo, multiplique por 10 sua frustração. Não vale a estadia! A localização e o tamanho do quarto são as únicas qualidades.

title: The best of the best
text:
This is a very classy, clean and quiet hotel in a very hip area of town. The location is amazing!

From the moment I walked in (worse for wear from travel), the staff treated me so warmly and were like connecting with friends. I was blown away by this – it is a very nice hotel and I honestly didn't look like I belonged there but I was treated very nicely. 

The room blew me away. The fixtures, linens and lighting are all high quality and well thought out. The amenities in the room:
1. Marshall speaker
2. Samsung tv that you can easily connect your phone to and stream content from your phone with a QR code (I'm not tech savvy and figured it out)
3. Each room has a smart gym workout mirror
4. Robes, slippers, stocked fridge and snacks
5. I forgot my curling iron and the room had its own straightener
6. Even the artwork in the rooms is top notch

The beds are comfortable, the headboard and nightstands good quality (and finally a hotel without a Gideon Bible!). I swam in the rooftop pool early morning and was delighted. Staff noticed and brought me a towel. 

Truly, this was one of my "best ever" hotel stays.

title: Nightmare on Gansevoort St.
text:
What a disaster. The noise from adjacent rooftop restaurants and clubs made it impossible to sleep. They should issue a warning with every reservation. 
It was so bad that I was ready to leave at 10:30pm , on a Tuesday! 
When I asked the front desk “is this normal? when do the usually quiet down?” Instead of answering my questions he just said, “I’ve never had a complaint before.” 
I would never go back and would warn everyone I know traveling to NY not to go there either.

title: Great Hotel in an Unbeatable Location
text: A very nice, newish hotel in the Meatpacking district. Very close to the highline, Chelsea market, jazz clubs, restaurants, etc. Staff is very friendly, clean rooms. The pool closes at 6pm which is was a bit annoying as several others would have stayed until at least sunset (7:30pm) for drinks and food. Our A/C also wouldn't adjust and was at a very frigid 63 degrees the entire time. A great stay overall and we hope to make it our "home" hotel.

title: Good place, great food and service, great atmosphere
text: I called to book a table for 8 people in the rooftop bar.  I found the process easy, the booking agent (Gabriella) was very responsive and courteous, she called back when she said we would.  I didn't get the typical NY take-it-or-leave-it attitude.  The bar was hopping but not overflowing, it was comfortably buzzy.

title: Fantastic Team
text:
Wonderful team that assisted in setting up a business lunch! We had a group of 13 people, and required a private meeting space. 
They catered lunch for us, and provided a wonderful event. 
Fantastic all around!
5 Stars!!

title: Five stars all around!
text: Wonderful experience at the Gansevoort! The customer service was superb and the spotless, spacious suite, was more than ample for our family of four. We were pampered for five nights and will absolutely return. The location can't be beat on the border of the Meatpacking district and Greenwich Village...a million times better than the hustle of mid-town/Times Square and ideal for experiencing neighborhood life in Manhattan.  Surrounding restaurants are plenty, subway a stones throw away, and the rooftop pool was great for the kids with excellent views.  Highly recommend!

title: Gabriella is THE BEST!
text: Gabriella was so attentive in helping me organize a corporate dinner. The ask was very last minute but she ensured all of my questions were answered and she even gave me a follow up call to ensure I was all set. 5 stars!

title: An elegant hotel in the heart of Chelsea
text: We were delighted with our four days at the Gansevoort - the rooms were very spacious, quiet, with plush bedding and bath linens. Housekeeping tidied up beautifully daily. The lobby cafe and adjacent restaurant were both perfect for brunch, coffee and a pick-me-up. We didn't have time to enjoy the rooftop bar or pool, but will do that next time. The front desk and concierge services were so efficient and professional. Overall we had a 10/10 experience, and will always stay here when visiting our son.

title: L’avis d’un professionnel de la restauration et de L’hotellerie
text: Très bel hôtel , chambre, magnifique, dommage que la piscine ferme aussitôt, malheureusement la partie restauration n’est pas à la hauteur, j’ai eu l’occasion de rencontrer le nouveau directeur qui est un homme absolument charmant, pas mal de petits réglages à faire, mais franchement, un très bel hôtel

title: Dreadful, would not recommend dining here
text:
Went for dinner for a special occasion 
Hugely disappointed
Unusual for USA, but the service was dreadful and the noise unbelievable 
Food was ok, saved really by the sushi which was good, everything else about the evening was decidedly mediocre

title: NYC TRIP
text: We had the most magical time at the Gansevort Hotel.  We especially appreciated Lauren Nordstrom who was so efficient, thoughtful, personable and a real asset to the hotel management.  Raul and Mike at the front desk were so helpful in making sure we had everything we needed. The rooms are beautiful and the atmosphere is so welcoming! We would return in a heartbeat.

title: The perfect visit
text:
We loved staying here!  The staff, including Mike at the desk and Raul-the bellman, were extremely nice, helpful and went the extra mile to make our visit magical.  The rooms were super clean, modern and were very comfortable.  We all slept later than we usually do in this comfortable setting.  The rooftop was beautiful and a great place to see so many different places in the city.  
We will absolutely be visiting again and will only stay at the Gansevort!

title: Marcel deserves a tip!  He was very helpful.
text: Love this hotel. Marcel was very helpful with my luggage when checking out and I didn’t have cash for a tip so I’d like him to be recognized by the establishment. Thank you!  All other service was also great but I had cash the entire time for tips except upon checkout.  I was also able to secure a late checkout. I stayed in a one bedroom suite which was also wonderful. Highly recommend the hotel. Only suggestion is the rooftop club shouldn’t close at midnight. It should stay open until 2AM which really means 1:30.  I couldn’t get upstairs at 11:30 last night for an after dinner drink and to enjoy the night view.  Overall, thumbs up and highly recommend the hotel. Ps: don’t forget to reward Marcel. Thanks again.

title: The Gansevoort is Great!
text: We loved staying at the Gansevoort Hotel in the Meatpacking District.  Our rooms were clean and stylish and very comfortable.  The views were fantastic! And the service was great - they still have turndown service which most other hotels seem to have forgotten.  Great shopping and restaurants in the area, as well.  We will definitely be back!

title: Disappointing and dingy
text:
Me and my partner booked one night at the Gansevoort for Pride weekend. We were expecting a swanky NY hotel, that i've often passed in the streets, or heard of people staying at, and it looks beautiful. The room was $685 for one night, a lot of money but we expected a lot too. I know this isn't a four seasons, but i expected a really nice experience.
Upon check in we asked if we could get a lower floor room because my partner has a fear of heights and elevators.
They couldn't accommodate and the 9th floor was the lowest room they had. We got into the elevators, which frankly appeared like freight elevators, their state looked extremely poor and dingy. OK.

When we got to our room, our key card folder said to just use "OK Google" because there's a smart nest thermostat in it. Well, sorry to spoil the story but there was no Google Nest. We had an old off brand thermostat. The room had messy caulk all over the molding and ceiling and floor. The aesthetic I guess they are going for is white and black, so for example white door, black handle. Well the black on the black handle had been shredded off so it looked like faded black into silver. Kind of like how you would imagine a hostel in Central Europe perhaps. There was a puddle of water in the bathroom next to the bathtub when we arrived, and a weird stain on the bed that we didn't realize until we laid down to go to sleep at 2 in the morning. No fridge in the room, but two cardboard boxed warm waters with "$8" on each of them. The toilet seat was black (remember the aesthetic) but looked like it was from an old apartment building and not in a good way. There was dirt and possibly mold in the corners of the bathroom.

After waking up in the morning we called room service to order 4 hot coffees to the room, and they said the wait would be over an hour (?). So I got dressed and headed down to the restaurant to get them to bring up, and they (l'm not kidding) cost $32 for 4 160Z coffees. The coffee was fine. The woman at the restaurant was very nice.

All of this to say, I paid $650-$680? something like that for this room and I expected quite a lot. If this was a Marriott courtyard or a hotel in the $300-400 area I wouldn't be complaining about this at all. But if the Ritz Carlton and Four Seasons were $985 for the same night, that $300 difference should add up to more than just a basic room with out the amenities even promised on the hotel keycard folder.

If you're looking for a really nice hotel in NYC, I would honestly suggest looking elsewhere

title: Birthday!
text: I had an amazing time  for my birthday, the staff was nice , accommodating , professional. That made we sure we had everything that we needed ! Thanks ,Gabriella for making my party amazing and fun !!!!

title: Gabriella at Concierge is reason enough to come here!
text: Gabriella Hurst (Concierge) is an absolute rockstar!  We had a family member celebrating a milestone birthday at the hotel and she expertly guided us on how to source balloons and treats to be delivered to the hotel and then she took the time and care to display them in the guest's room and take a picture for us.  She made the entire process seamless and easy for us, without pushing us to buy from the hotel's offering.  I can't say enough about how wonderful and attentive she was.

title: Surprisingly Pleasant
text:
Loved the hotel- amazing rooms, great views, excellent location, nice food options.

Was surprised by how well done the rooms were done- wood floors, clean design and functional.

Having lived in that hood, I was expecting a bad party crowd but found it charming and welcoming.

title: Nice to try once. Will go back to other hotels
text:
Good: location, easy walking distance to restaurants, West Village, Greenwich Village, High Line, room w/ a view of World Trade Center, bathroom w/ a tub (tub seems rare in NYC), sound sleep (didn't hear horn honks), rooftop pool with a view, gym, exclusive feel, robes, slippers for the mostly hard surface flooring.

Not so good: One chair in the room for the desk. One chair for two people w/ a queen bed, so the other must sit on the bed. I want to start the day off with coffee or tea. No coffee or tea in the room or the lobby in the morning when I was in the lobby before 7:30 am. Front desk workers said both nights when I was there coffee would be available in the lobby next morning, but was not. I would have been charged extra on top of the $700/night for a coffee maker to be brought to the room and charged $2 a pod. Gee, thanks. I was told by front desk worker I could walk to a Starbucks for coffee. Instead I walked about 10 minutes to an upscale grocer w/ a self-serve coffee bar that charged me only $2.50 w/ condiments included. Still, I would have much rather preferred the comfort and privacy of sipping coffee in my room while getting dressed for the day than wandering the neighborhood for a basic hospitality beverage, and it was raining. No clock or radio in the room. Did not use the yoga mirror. Marshall speaker is a nice vibe touch, but it didn't power on and we didn't have a compatible cord to plug in our phones. 

If you want to hang out at the rooftop or need to be in this neighborhood, then this is a good hotel. If you want the comforts of home away from home, with elegance, there are other hotels at better price points.

title: Hotel bien situé et branché pour un séjour merveilleux
text: Nous avons passé 4 nuits  , mère/fille dans une twin spacieuse avec une literie très confortable. Le service est chaleureux et efficace , le roof-top pour un cocktail et/ou dîner fantastique , le café sur la rue sympa et bon. Situation remarquable , près de Chelsea et Greenwich, face au Chelsea Market , entouré de restaurants , cafés , et belles boutiques. Un séjour enchanteur , ce sera notre hôtel à chaque visite dans la grosse pomme!

title: Our new favorite hotel in NYC!
text: This hotel has been upgraded majorly since the renovation. Our rooms were large, very clean and super chic. Just perfect. SPECIAL SHOUTOUT TO GABRIELLA IN GUEST SERVICES WHO IS AN ABSOLUTE ANGEL AND HELPED PUT THE CHERRY ON TOP OF OUR STAY WITH A WONDERFUL LAST MINUTE RESERVATION. She is the best!!

title: Gabriella Hurst is the GOAT!
text: Gabriella Hurst is my favorite team member to work with at the Gansevoort! She is so super awesome: friendly, warm, effective, and helpful. It's a pleasure to talk to her anytime I am arranging a visit on my behalf of my boss!

title: Gansevoort: A must stay
text: The Gansevoort is a must stay. The experience as a whole is wonderful. Also, the rooftop is absolutely stunning with great views of the city. The Chester is a great spot for a night cap. A huge shoutout to the director of the front office Lauren for making our trip special, and Denzel, Jason, and Marcel for also being extremely helpful.

title: Hotel located in a busy area - room a bit too loud for me
text: For the price ($700 per night) I was disappointed that my room was so loud and the service in the hotel lobby restaurant was poor.  We waited 30 minutes before anyone took our order.  While I was waiting a large cockroach crawled past me. I personally would not go here again, very pricey for what you get.

title: Great location but terrible service!
text: Nice location in the heart of the meatpacking district and ok rooms. More of a family hotel then for couples or business travelers. However the service from the staff was terrible - well below what you should expect at this price range. Can’t recommend it unfortunately.

title: The Gansevoort is a GEM in the heart of Chelsea!!!
text: Beautifully decorated! The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Our room was clean, and the housekeeping was completely flexible with our schedule without question as we had several morning zoom meetings! The restaurant in the lobby was delicious with a great selection, and it had great healthy options as well.  It's located steps from the Starbucks roastery, Chelsea Market, and shopping! Such a fabulous NYC experience!

title: How to make a guest feel like THE MOST SPECIAL GUEST :))
text: First - Gabriella is a dream! I miss her! My 11 year old son and I were visiting for spring break. I used to live in NYC and it was meaningful for me to bring my son there at an age where he can start to really absorb it. Not only did the staff at Gansevoort staff always treat us as if we were the only guests :)) and the most special, which feels so good! But when our flight was cancelled on our checkout day, they made it feel like no big deal to make new reservations for us and Gabriella very personally reached, so we knew if there were any more flight issues that she would make sure we were taken care of. It was such a special experience and we're so grateful to Gabriella and the entire staff. What a group. We can't wait to go back!

title: My stay at the Gansevoort
text: The Gansevoort is a great place to rest and recharge on a business trip.  The staff was friendly and exceptionally helpful throughout my stay.  After my trip I needed some additional help and when I called Gabriella Hurst answered the phone.  She is an absolute ray of sunshine, bursting with positivity and energy even on an 8am call and a bonafide asset to the hotel.  I thought I was talking to an old friend. Thank you Gansevoort and Gabriella for making my stay and after interaction so pleasant.

title: Dinner and drinks with a view to match
text: My company took our distributers to a dinner at the Gansevoort Rooftop. Our experience was flawless. Gabriella and Lisa made this dinner easy and made sure our group had an amazing time. Both of these ladies went above and beyond what was expected and I recommend the rooftop to everyone looking for a beautiful night in the meatpacking district. 10 out of 10

title: A Seriously Swanky Hotel.
text:
The Gansevoort  Meatpacking NYC is in the heart of the vibrant, cobblestone Meatpacking Packing District, one of the coolest places in the Big Apple.  With popular attractions such as the Whitney, the Highline and designer shopping just blocks away, it was ideal for my NYC exploring. The hotels brushes it's stylish innards  with modern decor and tantalizing art (even an original Banksy is installed).

I was impressed with my Deluxe Room outfitted with high ceilings, large windows and sophisticated colour scheme. It featured an array of high-tech room appliances and great selection of in-room services, a fitness mirror and a desk. Bath was marbleized with stainless sinks and all the usual accoutrements.
 
The Gansevoort encases a fleet of dining and drinking venues. The Chester is a classic American bistro & bar that is open breakfast, lunch and dinner and serves food fare from avocado toast to nifty burgers. Gansevoort Rooftop is an escape oasis serving inventive cocktails and Mediterranean food. Saishin,  also located on the rooftop, is the place that caters to sushi lovers (not my cup of tea). Coffee + Cocktails, is an establishment with a European vibe and a reputation for its French Toast. A great way to start and finish the day; with a sensational  coffee and a comforting cocktail. There is a mid-sized gym and a popular heated  rooftop pool opened all year round.

So, if you are looking for accommodations in a prime location near the art galleries of Chelsea, smart boutiques of the Meatpacking Area and the brasserie styled restaurants of West Village...........then try the.....Gansevoort .......A Seriously Swanky Hotel.

title: A great location but don’t expect too much
text: A nice hotel with a great location. Are you an experienced traveller your expectations shouldn’t be too high though. Nevertheless, all services provided are being conducted in a good manner but internationally compared they are average.

title: Loud and Proud
text: Nice location and the view of the Hudson River was good from the higher level room. The lobby has one couch and is small so meeting or waiting on friends inside the lobby is almost impossible- not great when it’s cold and raining outside. The average rating is due to the auto honking and sirens that seem to last deep into the night. I have stayed in NY many times and understand that there will always be street noise but this place was the loudest I have ever stayed in. For $600 per night plus a mandatory facility fee I expected more.

title: Great location, service
text: Travelled with my daughter, and some friends to a weekend getaway. Even when cold the kids loved swimming in roof top pool. Great service both at entrance as well as rooftop. Room was nice and beds comfortable.

title: Top notch friendly service! Great drinks and atmosphere!
text:
Had a wonderful first date experience with drinks, some eats, and desserts. Nino and Gina were top notch pros and handled our special request with grace and efficiency. 

Also I had forgotten a copy of the receipt and has an incredible conversation with Gabriella Husrt. 

I’ll definitely be back soon! 

Thank you all for a magical evening. 

I also hope to bring you film/tv/commercial/photo shoots and other events if you can accommodate them!

title: No focus on guest experience.
text: Great location and nice hotel, yet unfortunately very poor management. With no warning or care for the guest the management of the hotel had construction work start at 7am. Saws, drills and hammers. A total disregard for what it means to serve guest in the hospitality business. When contacting the front desk the only offer was an apology, no effort to stop the early morning disruption. With an upgrade to professional management this would be a great hotel.

title: HOME AWAY FROM HOME
text: I stayed at The Gansevoort for over a week, during Fashion Week for business, and it felt like my home away from home. All of the staff were extremely helpful, kind, and proactive. They took great care of me in so many ways, modifying room service due to allergies and preferences, the house-keeping was always timely and precise, the service team (John Ross and Marcel) were always at the door greeting me with a smile and asking how my day was. The team assisted with on site events, couriers, packages, and made my life so much easier during such a busy time. I felt safe, seen and cared for every single day. A huge shout out to Gabriella and Tamara (guest services), Cristobal (F&B), Natalie (Marketing), Anton (GM), and every single front desk associate. I will be back to New York soon, and you can bet I will be staying at The Gansevoort again.

title: Stayed one night to go to Hopper Exhibit at the Whitney
text: What a great hotel and location.  The Queen Room was great - loved the window overlooking the city with the electric shade.  Bed was comfortable and the room was clean and inviting.  The staff could not have been nicer.  We had a drink in the bar and breakfast in the small area downstairs.  My husband and I recommend this as a great place to say.  Within walking distance of lots of restaurants, shops and the Whitney.

title: Gabriella is great!!!
text: Gabriella Hurst is wonderful!!! She is a pleasure to speak with and helped book our dinner reservation with ease - very lovely and we are so thankful for her help. The Gansevoort is one of our favorite hotels in the city!!

title: MLK Day Sunday night getaway in the City turned out to be a pleasure.
text: We truly enjoyed our time here. We had only one night because of our other schedules but it was great because it's located in a neighborhood full of restaurants and boutique-y stores plus The Whitney is a short walk down the street. The hotel itself has nice, comfortable rooms and is staffed by nice, accommodating people who were attentive to our every need.  Because it's located in a bustling part of the city parking can be tough but the hotel offers a reasonably priced valet service. In winter the prices are remarkably fair for a Manhattan hotel.

title: A wonderful NYC stay!
text: First time in NY since before COVID and the Gansevoort was a perfect hotel to reignite our love for NYC.  The location is wonderful - right near the Whitney.  The room was beautiful, quiet and large (for NYC) with an expansive view of the Meatpacking district and the river.  We were on the 9th floor - it was quiet and peaceful.  The hotel is welcoming and beautifully maintained.  I asked for a coffee machine in the room, and there it was!  All staff were smiling and friendly.  This was an exceptional hotel experience and I look forward to returning.

title: Loved our Gansevoorting stay!
text:
Over the years, we've stayed at many different hotels throughout Manhattan, whether for business or pleasure. The Gansevoort Meatpacking is our favorite one for reasons too numerous to list. In a few words, great location and impeccable service. The room was large, clean and comfortable, which isn't always the case when staying in the city. 
The staff was welcoming, resourceful, pleasant and efficient. We also appreciated the help we got from Lauren during our stay.
As Arnold once said, ''I'll be back''!

title: Amazing Service
text: I booked the day before a stay and when I arrived (after check in time) the room type I booked was not available, but the hotel was unable to change my room tier in the system for some reason. Marisela Torres and Nicole were absolutely amazing, and were so concerned that I had to wait over an hour for a room to be ready for me. They ended up upgrading me because I had to wait so long, and were absolutely so kind about it. The room was lovely and the staff was so kind over the course of my stay because they were so sorry about the issues with the booking. Marisela was incredibly kind and took the time to make sure every moment and aspect of my stay was perfect, she was amazing!

title: Favorite Hotel
text: Our go to hotel every time we stay in the city! John Dzakpa, the bellman is so helpful & respectful. He truly goes the extra mile and makes our stay amazing every time we come. Can’t recommend this hotel and him enough!

title: Great Layout and Service!
text: Absolutely amazing Hotel! The beds and pillows are excellent. The room had a separate desk and sitting area with a door between that and bedroom with 2 separate HVAC units so you can regulate the room temperatures better. It also had a separate powder room which is great when staying with more than 1 person. The room was always clean, items refreshed each day and lots of drinking water! Loved this hotel. Will come again.

title: The only positive about this hotel is the location
text:
I will start with the one positive and that is the location, this hotel is in a good location with walking distance to lots of nice restaurants and sights but that is the only thing going for it.

I am staggered how poor the customer service was at this hotel.  On arrival after a long haul flight from London I was told the room which I had written confirmation (double checked pre arrival) and verbal confirmation as I called ahead to confirm as well, was not the room I was getting and there was nothing that could be done as the hotel was fully booked.  The worst part was not even that this was the case despite all efforts to confirm a room with 2 beds one each for my friend and I but that the girl checking us in told me I had was the one who misunderstood and that was not my booking despite showing her the written confirmation.  She had the attitude of a spoilt teenager who did not want to be there, not the front of house one would expect of such hotel.  Finally we got to speak to a manager who could also do nothing but was marginally more polite than the first girl with the attude, we were given a free drink voucher in the bar whilst they out a fold out bed in our room.

This hotel has zero sound proofing, great if you are out until 4am every night, if you are not and you don't wish to listen to every single noise on the street I would look for another hotel with adequate noise proofing.

The rooftop bar is overrated, something close to a store cafe would be a better assessment.  The front of house again was poor, no consideration for guests v anyone who walks off the street and just told to sit whereever and go to the bar to get yourself a drink.

I can honestly say I would never stay at this hotel again.

title: Wonderful Experience
text: Visiting NYC for the shows and sightseeing with my daughter, and we had an amazing experience at the Gansevoot.  From the accessibility by car, the views from the balcony, to the courteous and helpful staff, we were made to feel special as soon as we drove up. First impressions go a along way- and our first  was with the warmhearted Bellman John Dzakpa.  He immediately made us feel welcome, so genuine and sincere. My 13 year old daughter even acknowledged  "how nice they are here" The receptionist, and bar staff were also helpful, offering recommendations for local dining. The room was impeccable . But what stood out the most was the staff, with a special shout out to John, who felt like a friend by the time we left. Would definitely go back

title: My preferred go-to hotel in NYC
text:
I stay at this hotel OFTEN - my office is located nearby -and this is one of the best locations in NYC.

What I'll also call out -- mannnny hotel rooms in NYC are teeny tiny (look at square ft before you book) -- but Gansevoort Meatpacking has tons of rooms that are pretty large.

I also have to call out one of the staff here who is a BREATHE of fresh air-- Gabriella. She is warm, helpful, full of the best energy. I actually look forward to when I have the pleasure of engaging with her.

title: My fav hotel in nyc
text:
I visit New York several times a year and I have stayed at a bunch of different hotels over the years. But in November I came to New York on business and John Ross was so kind and so helpful at the Gansevoort that I decided to come back to the Gansevoort with my whole family. John Ross was working again when we came back over Thanksgiving week and he was super kind with my whole family. We love the location of the hotel and the rooms are super comfortable. I also like the views and the general vibe of the place. 

If the Gansevoort management team is reading this please give John Ross a nice bonus for a job well done! We will be coming back many many times and I’ve already referred several friends to your hotel.

title: Pure Pomp.  Smoke and Mirrors.
text:
For the Ratchet; By the Ratchet.

The following is the email I sent to the General Manager.  For which I never received a reply.  I removed the names of employees.

Good Morning General Manager, 

I've not had the moment to write you back as I've been quite busy.  I was married on the fifth and was entertaining family who flew in for the wedding.  

I cannot begin to tell you how disappointing our stay at the Gansevoort was.  Aside from the deplorable state of room 1005, which had clearly not been properly cleaned for weeks; the overall experience of the stay left me wishing I'd never booked with you.  The only reason we did not depart to another property was that we were getting married.  Too many moving pieces for a move like that on such short notice.  And proximity to the wedding venue was of great concern.  

Aside from the state of the room I was very curtly informed upon arrival that the early checkin I'd been assured I had by your reservationist, was not available.  I told the woman working the desk that I had been promised an early check in when I'd called a week earlier.  She simply said that early check-in is not a guarantee and only a request.  No apology, no concern.  It was my problem.  This was the first of several charming exchanges I had with a Ms.  X as she is referred on my invoices.
  
If I had been aware of that early check-in policy I would not have adjusted my travel Itenerary to be at the hotel early.  As you might imagine the hours and days immediately before getting married are quite valuable.  I would have used that time more efficiently than showing up for a room which was not ready.  And the less I spoke to your employees the better the stay would have been.

The approach Ms. X employs in her communicating with guests can be found over and over at your property.  The young lady who works the evening desk shift seems genuinely annoyed by my approaching her.  The only woman who works the door is also extremely annoyed about having to do her job.  The general sense I get from the woman working the door is disdain.  Interrupted only by the occasional rolling of her eyes.  It's as though someone forces her to go to that job every day.  And then doesn't pay her.  

My hospitality experience is extensive.  I've been in the industry for twenty two years.  Most of them in Manhattan.  I ran venue's X and X; amongst others.  It's as though your staff is under the impression that the name Gansevoort does the actual work for them.  They've collectively gotten their feet under the dinner table and now they get to relax.  And whatever problems arise are those of the guests.  

I'm sure you have many guests who buy into the lure of Gansevoort.  I'm not one of them.  I'm not paying for a name.  I want the actual experience.  And the experience was an embarrassment.  Especially for the price we paid.  I'm not the person who wants to speak with the manager.  I'm not the person who calls out employees.  But this was outrageous.

I'm really an easy going customer.  But not at $685.00 - $745.00 a night.  And I realize that with the money we spent we are still likely on the low end of money spent by your clientele.  But if this is as good as it gets for spending $5200.00 +/- in your hotel than you should should make that information public.  So people know what they are actually going to get before they commit. 

Your bellhops and valet were good.  Genuine guys.  Actually looking to do their job without seeming incovieninced.   But that's it.

Genuinely wishing we'd spent our money elsewhere,

title: Fabulous boutique hotel, surprisingly family-friendly
text: The hotel's location is extraordinary, walkable to countless wonderful experiences- the Whitney museum, the Highline, The Little Island, the heart of the West Village. Location really makes it stand out, but the staff goes above and beyond and the hotel itself is chic, super comfortable, really clean and overall wonderful. We ate at the lovely lobby bar/restaurant upon arrival and also at the larger Chester restaurant. Both were fresh and delicious. The weekend we were there was cold and it was so nice to be inside and cosy at Chester, but with the large windows you feel like you are outside. I cannot recommend this hotel enough. We went with our small children and the hotel accommodated us with connecting rooms and were so gracious to our young/rambunctious boys.  It was nice to pop up to the roof bar or the cosy lobby bar once the kids were down! Even though there is a super cool roof bar and the city is all around you, you do not hear a thing in your rooms. Overall a wonderful experience, highly recommended!

title: Amazing Customer Service
text: A large group of us stayed at the Gansevoort for a big event in October and had the best time. Almost a month later I realized that I had ordered clothes and had them shipped to the hotel instead of my home address in California. I was panicked because these clothes were important and I needed them by the end of the week. I called the hotel and was directed to Gabriella to help me with this. I gave her all my information and she found the package and had it overnighted to me within an hour. This type of service is why this will be the only hotel I stay at in New York City. Thanks to the amazing team at the hotel who made this all possible.

title: Best Pannecotta I have ever had
text:
Excellent restaurant, amazing cocktails and lovely food. So glad we stopped off here, can highly recommend.
I had the Cinema Paradiso cocktail with a burger. The cocktail had a whipped egg yolk topping, reminiscent of a snowball but very tasty. Burger was cooked to perfection and really tasty.

title: Great Customer Service
text: I stayed at this hotel for a business trip, but decided to extend my stay to visit friends in the city. Marisela T. checked me in and was kind, welcoming, and accommodating. I really appreciated her help.

title: GUEST RELATIONS COORDINATOR
text: Friends stayed at the GANSEVOORT MEATPACKING and i wanted to send some items to surprise them. I was lucky enough to get GABRIELLA HURST on the phone. She went above and beyond to achieve what I wanted. She sent me pictures and video so I can see how everything turned out. I was very appreciated for all that she did. She has a great attitude and is super personable. Thank you for all you did.

title: Terrible, negligent staff experience
text:
While a guest at the Gansevoort, I asked the front desk to schedule a Fedex pick up for 2 prepaid, ready-to-ship packages I needed sent. They assured me they could handle the pick up and I left them with the concierge and checked out. Unfortunately, my boxes were never shipped, my tracking shows the packages were never picked up.

I am absolutely devastated because those packages carried perishable, invaluable contents: while traveling for work, I overnight pumped breast milk back to my infant at home. It's literally the only thing that allows me to travel for work while nursing. Any fellow traveling moms out there know that every feed is priceless and I lost about 4 days worth of milk to the Gansevoort.

If there was any issue with the package I expected them to contact me but no one ever did. Wondering if the concierge just didn't want to deal with it and tossed it? Pretty unforgivable.

I just called the hotel to let them know what happened and the person talking to me seemed more concerned with finding out who did it than anything. I don't want any money, what I lost was irreplaceable, I just want them to retrain staff to be honest or empathetic to guests so no one goes through the same thing I did.

title: Avoid this hotel
text:
We left the hotel after one night!! 
Big No! 
One of the most basic poor hotel we’ve ever been. 
It began with the unpleasant and inpatient front desk welcoming. We had problems with the credit card and the lady from the front desk team gave us a very unpleasant feeling. We and our family have suffered a real stress. Of course that after we spoke with visa everything was ok but the bad feeling and trauma that they gave us is something we will never forget. 
After we received the room we discovered that they sold us a second room that was not necessary just to double the price!!
There heat in the room didn’t work even after we switched rooms. It was very cold. 
The breakfast was not good. 
It took too long until we received the refund.   They really charged us instead of holding the money. 
They also wanted to charge us for orthopaedic pillows. 
Ridiculous. 
You pay for a room with a balcony but they don’t let you smoke there and you have to sign when you arrive that it will cost 500$. That’s not acceptable when they even didn’t let me smoke outside the hotel on the sidewalk !!
They ruined our trip to New York. 
Except Gabriella the concierge that was great, everything went wrong. Everything!
This is definitely not a 5 stars hotel. 
Never come back again.

title: Great staff made a great stay
text: Thanks so much to the Gansevoort team who made our team's stay terrific.  Particularly thank you to John Ross,  who anticipated our needs with a lot of kindness and grace (umbrellas, got luggage into my car without us asking and had my car out-front on time). And thank you to the staff in the restaurant for knowing our coffee preferences on day 2.  The team clearly has a good vibe and sense of purpose in their work, and creates moments that matter.  TY!

title: Great Hospitality! Perfect location!
text: Our accommodations were spectacular!  The entire staff at the Gansevoort were friendly, helpful and knowledgeable.  My contact, Gabriella, went above and beyond to unsure the family had all their reservations booked and confirmed.  She was so helpful and patient with all my changes!

title: Fantastic staff, wonderful views
text: We had pre-anniversary dinner drinks at the rooftop bar.  We were warmly welcomed and got a lovely table with fantastic views. I love cocktails, but am not a fan of masses of ice, but the bar staff were very accommodating and put minimum ice in for me. This was in great contrast to the previous evening, where the bar that we were in, refused to serve me a cocktail without ice. Thank you Gansevoort for your excellent hospitality

title: NYC getaway
text: We have found our NYC home. I used to live in the city, and we love to come out ourselves and with our kids. We’ve stayed in other hotels near Union Square - great hotels - but this was hands down our best trip. The location is just beyond perfect. We spend most of our trip in this area and while it’s close to Union Square, walking out the door and being steps from everything including the Hudson River Parks is just beyond perfect. The view from our room was stunning. If we didn’t love wandering the city so much, we could have just sat on the couch staring out the window. We cannot wait to bring our kids back to this spot. Room was great, staff was very friendly. We loved it and cannot wait to come back!

title: GREAT HOTEL IN NYC
text:
This hotel had a great staff and very professional, and let me check out late.
The rooms were cleaned everyday, and the location was great with balconies located in the room.I would highly recommend this hotel for any business travelers,
or anyone that is thinking about staying in NYC.

title: Perfect location, amazing concierge
text: The hotel was situated in the perfect location for our staycation with wonderful amenities—even though it was chilly, the rooftop pool was amazing. But our trip wouldn’t have been as special without help from the wonderful Gabriella who recommended a dining itinerary that was perfect for us. She made special arrangements for us to snag hard to get reservations and picked the perfect times for us to visit the pool. She even checked on us to make sure our stay was perfect. Highly recommend !

title: Deeply Enjoyable Stay
text:
Gansevoort is a great hotel, the staff are friendly and efficient, the rooms are well appointed, chic and understated.  The beds are amazingly comfortable.  There is very little I could fault.

BUT ... I would love a fresh coffee in my room first thing, there is a great banquette to sit on by the window and watch the world go by outside - but I want a coffee to do that, especially first thing. 

Secondly .. the fabled rooftop bar - seems to have let itself go a little.  If im going to pay 25 dollars for a negroni I want one that isnt made with Martini Rosso .. and I dont want the barman to go completely off piste with the ingredients of an Old fashioned either. 

Without these 2 niggles it would have been 5 star all the way.

title: Fantastic Location
text: We stayed for 2 nights en route to London; myself and my 17 year old daughter.  The location is great, right on the Highline, surrounded by nice shops and restaurants.  The staff were all very friendly and helpful.  There is a small gym and the rooms were a decent size for New York, with comfortable beds. I would definitely stay there again and recommend to a friend.

title: Amazing Customer Service
text:
I did not pesonally stay at this location but my boss did and I needed to contact the hotel to obtain the invoice/folio. I spoke to Ms. G. Hurst who was phenomenal. 
The fact that live person with a friendly voiced picked up after one ring (no automated machine) and was able to help me immediately (no holds, transfers), and made sure I received the email with information I requested left me flabbergasted. Kudos for providing real human interactions and solution-oriented service and particularly thanks to Ms. Hurst who was fun, approachable, helpful, and very polite.

Bravo

title: Unbelievable Location, Fantastic Service, Superb Hotel!!
text: As you can see by my reviews I've stayed at countless 5 star hotels nationwide, moving forward when I travel to NYC I'll always be in the West Village, Meatpacking District and I'll be staying at The Gansevoort. I recently returned from a friends 50th birthday in which I booked the Gansevoort, we called ahead on the way from JFK and they allowed me to order room service so our food arrived 15 minutes after checking in because we had to get to MSG to see Billy Joel!! The food was fantastic, service impeccable, the hotel was perfect in every way. Our room 1016 had unbelievable views, a great little balcony and the rooftop pool was a huge added bonus. The location is the BEST in the Meatpacking, Sammy the Manager at The Chester was incredibly accommodating and opened the kitchen to bring my friend a Birthday dessert after Billy Joel! I absolutely loved everything about The Gansevoort and look forward to returning with my wife!!

title: Customer Service was excellent!
text: Specifically, John Ross was very inviting every time we crossed paths in the hotel. He went above and beyond to make sure to anticipate any needs we had. Our trip to the Gansevoort felt like home because of the excellent customer service. Thank you!

title: Me
text: The entire staff were accommodating and warm. John Ross is a gem. He greets everyone with a smile and is super attentive to all the guests’ needs. When you’re thinking about what you need to happen next, he already has it in motion assuring you that you can begin relaxing during your stay.

title: Amazing location
text: Amazing location, very walkable and convenient. Nice rooftop pool area with great views and a mellow, family friendly feel. Staff were friendly and helpful throughout our stay.  Clean and comfortable rooms with nice amenities. Thanks for great service John R!

title: AC very poor
text: Fairly hot in nyc right now. Our AC is terrible in our room. If you don’t move it’s livable but taking a shower and getting ready is pretty awful. It feels really muggy and stale. I have asked the front desk 3 times for the engineer to fix it but there is no indication anybody has even come to the room. Certainly no follow up from he front desk. Just unimpressive for what this room costs per night.

title: Dissapointing
text:
Location is excellent, however I did not get one sleep at this hotel due to the noise.

There was an awful noise throughout the night and also a lot of slamming of doors that could be heard.

Really disapointed

title: Really good hotel in a superb part of town
text: This hotel is loacted brilliantly in the artsy, hip and funky part of Manhattan. The hotel itself provides good service. Shout out to Nicole on reception and extra special thanks to John Dzakpa on the door - always a great welcome from him and such a lovely guy.

title: 3.5 Stars
text:
3.5 Stars

Staycation at the Gansevoort. 

The good: nice room with decent space for New York City. Comfortable bed. Decent bathroom. Great area - can walk around to plenty of restaurants, bars, shopping, etc. Has a rooftop pool, bar, and restaurant.  Rooftop pool temperature was perfect (I believe it’s  heated). 

The bad: prices. Maybe due to inflation, but the prices, even for New York City rooftops, seemed a little steep. 

More bad: the pool. Seating is limited. Pool can get packed on a Saturday, including families with young children. Essentially have to sit on the floor on the side of the pool and run to her a seat when someone gets up and leaves. Seating is also that - actually seating. Only 2-3 lounges chairs. Everything else is a chair or couch. Can get food and drink poolside, but during peak weekend hours, it can take some time.  

Pool was great for people watching, though. 

Overall, if you don’t expect a nice, quiet relaxing time at the pool, it’s decent. Maybe better during the week.

title: Top notch hotel in a very safe part of New York that is convenient to so many different neighborhoods.
text: This was a beautiful hotel in a terrific part of New York City. It was surprising to me because the last time I was in New York the meatpacking district was very quiet with nothing but meatpacking going on. Now it is a place with so much energy, great restaurants, nice shopping and right next to the Highline. The hotel is gorgeous with beautiful views of the river. We stayed in a king room and it was very large with a pull out sofa, a very comfortable king size bed. The towels were really plush and the bathrooms were also very plush.There was more than ample room especially for a New York hotel. Also there is a lovely pool on the roof which we enjoyed using for our morning lap swim. Everyone at the hotel was lovely and very helpful. The service was terrific and the hotel itself is just beautiful. There is a rooftop restaurant and bar that has amazing views of Manhattan. I feel so spoiled having stayed there that when returning to New York, I don’t think I can stay anywhere else. This is a gem of a hotel in a great location.

title: Shout out to the staff!
text: I discovered two weeks after I checked out that I had left behind a favorite dress. I contacted the hotel and Gabriella H in Guest Services went beyond the call of duty to locate my dress in Lost and Found and send it back to me. She provided the most seamless, expeditious and professional customer service I have ever received in my life. She was so attentive and responsible, what a SUPERSTAR!!!! The fact that the hotel had a process for returning lost items was impressive and the coordination amongst staff to get my dress back to me is much appreciated. Also a special thanks to James in Security for helping with this process. Thank you so much!

title: Great hotel!
text: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights with family (kids 11 and 4), we wouldn’t hesitate to return here. Staff are lovely and helpful, rooms spotless and spacious, rooftop pool was amazing with fantastic views. The location is excellent, close to many restaurants, Chelsea market, and the start of the high line.  Would definitely recommend.

title: Great Customer Service!
text:
I stayed here for 2 weeks recently and had an absolutely amazing time. 
From the moment I walked in, I was greeted so kindly by JohnRoss. Every day when I would come in or out of the hotel, he would greet me with the biggest smile and always ask how I was doing, followed up with always offering help. He was very sweet and professional. This treatment made me really enjoy staying here. Which I will be coming back! The cleaning service was wonderful as well. All around, great staff, and LOVED my room, I had a nice view of South Manhattan.

title: The worst experience ever
text:
Staying at this hotel was the worst experience we have ever had in NYC (during 20 years). 

The bad experience started already before we even checked into the hotel. We had booked a transportation through the hotel (they tried to raise the price after we had already agreed on it and booked it) from the airport to the hotel with a child seat and reconfirmed the reservation before the arrival. Once we met the driver at the airport, we instantly noticed that the child seat was missing. The real struggle started at that point after an 9hr flight and multiple hours’ time difference, with a baby and a pregnant lady in our party, as when we instantly phoned the hotel and informed them of the situation, they apologised but at the same time said that we need to handle the situation by ourselves. Simultaneously the driver who originally came to pick us up left with his car and we were forced to return back to the terminal to start to fix the situation. Finally, after multiple calls and messages later, the transportation company’s driver went to buy a compatible child seat, returned to the airport after which WE spent almost an hour installing the car seat in the car at a busy pick-up spot. Finally, we arrived at the hotel 4 hours after our flight had landed, and all the while with nobody from the hotel having contacted us or having expressed any concern for our wellbeing or safety. 

When we arrived at the hotel, we were offered an upgrade on the lowest floor with hotel rooms right above the restaurant next to the elevators (in the original reservation we had asked for a room on high floors away from the elevators). As a result we refused that room and were moved to a suite one floor higher on the fourth floor. In addition we were offered the first night without charge, and instead of any further compensation we requested for, they said that we can leave the hotel earlier than what we had booked it for. So in between the lines, we read that after everything that had happened we are also undesired guests at the hotel.

Except for all this, the hotel is well located, but there were many issues in the room. For instance a fire alarm going off in our room and only after contacting the front desk we learned that it was probably a false alarm as well as the almost constant smell of weed and loud noise at nights from the surrounding bars in our room. 

At the check out the hotel offered to compensate almost our full stay because of what had happened, but nonetheless, we definitely cannot recommend this place to anyone.

title: Valeu muito a pena!
text: Ficamos muito satisfeitos com esse hotel. Em primeiro lugar, a localização: perfeita. É possível tomar café da manhã e jantar cada dia em um local diferente, todos ótimos! Em poucos minutos a pé estamos no Chelsea Market; na Little Island; no High Line; e têm uma Starbucks Reserva excelente bem pertinho. Além disso, os quartos e banheiros são novos e de ótimo tamanho, confortáveis. A equipe do hotel é super simpática e atenciosa; o pessoal do bar muito querido; e tem um Rooftop e uma piscina com uma linda vista e o serviço de camareiras era super rápido e eficiente!. Enfim, valeu muito a pena! Reservamos pelo Booking com antecedência e conseguimos uma boa tarifa.

title: Great luxury hotel. Perfect location
text:
Everything was perfect in this hotel especially the rooftop pool and bar.
The rooms are super well equipped
Staff is very cordial.
Location is perfect, with great restaurants around and 2 blocks away from Chelsea Market.
Cons: the drinks and cocktails at the pool bar are $26.00!

title: Hôtel surévalué pour le prix. Expérience très décevante
text: The first moments upon arrival are perfect.  The valet, reception staff and especially the boy who took care of our luggage are exceptionally nice, polite and friendly.  The room is just fine for the price… No coffee machine, only one bathrobe and no ice machine in the hotel.  But where the experience is completely spoiled is at the rooftop bar restaurant and at the swimming pool… The staff is pretentious and not welcoming.  No cocktails or non-alcoholic beer and the most insulting thing is that access to the canopy "the most pleasant and comfortable place in the place" is reserved for the group of 6 people and more!!!  Seriously???  While most of the rooms are for 2 people???  And that there was no one there the whole time we were there?  In addition, the pool closes at 7 p.m.... So if you come for a day and have to leave early in the morning, that gives you 3 hours to enjoy it because check-in cannot be done before 4 p.m.  And at 4 p.m. it's already full and the guy at the entrance looks at you like you're an alien when you ask him if there's room.  In short, there are many nicer and more welcoming hotels in New York.  Your reputation is overvalued and you will never see me there again.

title: Great stay at Gansevoort Meatpacking NYC
text:
Stayed at Gansevoort Meatpacking NYC for a business trip. Perfect. Room was clean and comfortable. Staff was nice, smiling and helpful! 

Right beside a ton of great restaurants and not so far from The High Line, Soho, World Trade Center, etc.

title: Amazing experience
text: We stayed 2 nights with our two daughters. We had an amazing time. The beds so comfortable and sheets were so luxurious.  Rooms were spacious and loved all the products- L'occataine. The staff were super and so helpful. Jodie  who served us coffee in the morning and cocktails in the evening was so efficient and friendly. The pool was superb. We could of spent all our time in the hotel, however it is located in such a great neighborhood, within walking distance to bars, restaurants, shopping not to mention little island and the high line. I would highly recommend the cocktails and sushi on the roof top.

title: You’ll love it!
text:
We booked the Gansevoort way in advance and was not our first stay at this exceptional place!
It was our first post-pandemic stay in the US and we got the same outstanding service as before. Special thanks to Gabriella Hurst for her great assisting us to get a hairdresser’s appointment as we were traveling in from Canada by car, this despite poor network coverage (far from easy): Thanks Gabriella!
The meatpacking offers a lot of possibilities: Use them, book the restaurants in advance!
We’ll be back and it won’t take us 2 Years

title: Great hotel with pool
text: Stayed here for 2 nights with a friend and we loved it. Decent sized room and large bathroom. Robes and slippers provided. Rooftop pool was great during summer in New York. Friendly staff and housekeeping was lovely. Location is good for trains and Chelsea markets.

title: Stellar Staff!
text: I don't often write reviews but our recent stay at the Gansevoort warrants one. We were celebrating our 20th anniversary and due to a series of complications needed to cancel and rebook a number of times. When we finally made it in on July 4th, we were greeted with warmth, courtesy, water bottles and a super early check in! From the valet, to Lauren at the front desk, the entire staff could not have been nicer or more welcoming. The star of the show here, though, is John Ross who brought us to our room and seems to wear many hats. I think he should be promoted to manager immediately. His smile lights up a room and he gave us a fist bump every time we passed him in the lobby, it made us feel so special. He told us about fireworks on the Hudson from the roof (saving us a crowded trip to the East River) and was a huge help at check out with our car. Can't say enough good things, give this man a raise immediately!! The hotel itself is spectacular, from the fun location (Little Island, Highline, Chelsea Market) to the Banksy in the lobby to the very trendy rooftop pool (shout out to Clarisse who helped us find chairs.) I also loved that you could fit some of your own things in the mini-fridge and that they offer L'Occitane products that are individual, not attached to the wall like so many hotels now. We are already planning our next getaway in August so we can bring our teenage daughter who, if it's possible, will love it even more than we do. Thank you all for the anniversary treats and making it one to remember!

title: Superb location, a peaceful haven in a crazy city!
text: I would absolutely recommend this family owned hotel!  We stayed for a week and loved the location, away from the carnage and close enough to explore.  Heading over to Little Island at nigthtime is an absolute must!

title: Everything I hoped for... plus more
text:
