Where do I start? While my daughter was away at college. I brought my wife and son to NYC for a spring get away (we live just outside Boston). I used to live in the meat packing district in the 90s, so I am always in awe with it's transformation. 

Stepping foot in the The Gansevoort is like the first sip of coffee in the morning, or that much needed drink at the end of the day. The patio surrounding the hotel is a nice buffer from the street and provides a sense of importance as you are one of those who gets to go beyond the crowd and into the hotel. Once inside you are greeted by the warmth the guest services people and the perfect temperature and fragrant clean air.  There is a stylish little eatery in the lobby which is perfect to start your stay if you arrive before check in or a great place to end your stay with a snack before you hit the road after check-out. 

The rooms are surprisingly large. With big bathrooms and walk-in showers. The place in clean (which for me is super important - and there are no pillows or throws that you need to put away for fear of those not being changed). The plugs are in all the right places as are the lights. The sheets and towels are top quality and the shower soaps and personal provisions are generous and luxurious. Each room also comes with a small balcony that provides a great view of the Meat Packing District (the hotel is among the taller buildings in the area so every room has a view - that's rare in NYC)

The rooftop lounge is awesome! Great drinks and food. Best bet to stick with apps. And the rooftop pool is so refreshing for a morning swim, It's heated, big enough for some laps. Offers an amazing view and provides such a vigor at the beginning of your day.  Words can't describe what it adds to your stay  - you just feel great afterwards. And that feeling makes the rest of the day so much better.  

The area is like a little Madison avenue. The surrounding stores offer a great selection of European luxury and American style. I highly recommend Belstaff - the British rugged clothing maker. Also the Highline is right there as in Chelsea Market and the most upscale Starbuck you'll ever see. 

The Gansevoort was everything I hoped it would and more. It really made my trip to NYC with my family. I highly recommend!

title: Ok but ? If I would return
text:
Probably not stay again. First of all the staff was very good. Always available and friendly. Room service was efficient and the orders were always correct. However, from day one the air conditioning didn’t work well our room was warm and slightly humid after 3 requests they finally sent an engineer. He tried but was unsuccessful. He said a fan was available and it was brought to the room and it did help but it seems that it should have been fixed and not ignored the situation. Oh, they sent 4 cookies and a bottle of water to make up for the lack. One other thing. There was a gentleman working the front lobby. I think his name was John  and he was spectacular. He helped us get to places and in general was invaluable. It’s a shame the others were not as good. 

Brian kiel

title: July 4th weekend getaway
text:
From the moment we pulled up and was greeted by the most pleasant individual named  , Cem who went above and beyond anytime we saw him during our stay giving us great advice on where to visit , providing water as we were overheating after an am run , or holding our bags  upon departure I cannot say enough about our fabulous experience at the Gansevoort . 

Each front desk attendant and the additional bell men we had the pleasure of meeting  - naming John Ross and John were very friendly and helpful .

The rooms and property  are immaculate . Great  walkable location  to many bars , boutiques and restaurants . 

Pool and rooftop restaurant / bar also impressive .
Only negative comment is staff at pool and rooftop bar , along with  staff of Coffee & Cocktail restaurant in lobby  not overly friendly with service only being fair . 

Overall will never stay anywhere else on my next visit to NYC .

title: Pride Perfection
text: This hotel is perfection.  From the first person to great us (Gem) to the last person (Denzel) the Gansevoort is everything a luxury hotel in NYC should be.  Room service was rapid and delicious.  The pool sublime.  Not sure I’ll ever stay any other place.

title: The Gansevoort exceeded expectations
text:
My husband and I had a splendid weekend at The Gansevoort.
To begin, the staff is warm and accommodating; we were greeted as  we were entering  the lobby.
Our hotel room provided  comfort and luxury; many amenities were provided; 
such as a Juliet balcony, one and 1/2   gorgeous bathrooms  and a king size  bed with linens that were sumptuous.  The contemporary artwork is a beautiful creative touch. All was absolutely pristine in our suite. We could not have asked for more.

The menu  at the Gansevoort is varied and creative; simple fare such as burgers are always available.  (my husband's go-to for lunch)
but I had the tuna tartare  which was a memorable dish that I will definitely order again. The pumpkin tortelloni for dinner was exceptional. Attention to detail is evident with every dish. On our next visit I  will certainly try the sushi. 
The heated roof top pool and bar is a treat. Such an inviting and self-indulgent experience.
The location of the Gansevoort is so convenient.
We walked to the Whitney Museum of American Art, the Chelsea Market, The High Line Park, and the new Little Island Pier. 
Our thanks to the staff; each and every person obviously does their best and cares about the guests.

title: A very pleasant stay
text: My wife and I both agreed this is one of the best hotels we stayed. The location is great. Everything is in walking distance. The front desk Pierre is very friendly and welcoming. The rooftop bar and swimming pool has great view and vibes. Will certainly comeback again.

title: Great service - thanks Pierre!
text: Great service from Pierre Marisela at the front desk. I was in a real time crunch and he helped me get some things taken care of. My family and I have stayed here various times over the years and are pleased with some of the changes in recent times. Especially enjoy the new French style cafe … excellent Italian espresso!

title: Family Friendly
text:
We were in the city with my 4 month old grandson who  needed to eat lunch.  Breastfeeding in NYC is not as easy as you might think, no one takes reservations, too much paparazzi exposure and above all the distractions for a 4 month old are insane ! 
Well we had concierge service from Pierre, loveliest and kindest Gansevoort employee! Provided discreet area for babies lunch! We are eternally grateful to this lovely, chic hotel  and Pierre above all!

title: Beautiful boutique hotel with an amazing location.
text:
Together with some friends we enjoyed a fantastic stay at the Gansevoort last weekend. 

The area around the hotel has a superb vibe, full of restaurants, bars and situated within easy walking distance of Chelsea, the Village, Soho, High Line etc.

The hotel itself is chic, boutique in style, with lots of high end amenities and amazing staff who simply cannot do enough to please all of the time.

Having stayed in many different locations throughout New York in the past, I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

title: The Perfect Weekend Away
text: I had an amazing stay in the Gansvoort!! Our suite was perfect it had everything we wanted and we thought the workout mirror was so cool. We had a lovely evening in the rooftop bar with a great atmosphere and amazing views. We were so well taken care of, the staff are so friendly and helpful. The hotel is in the perfect location with so much to do. Would highly recommend staying here! Can't wait to return.

title: Cool spot to stay in NYC
text: I've stayed here before and upon my return was pleasantly surprised to see that they've redone the whole place. First thing I noticed was a Banksy in the Lobby (amazing) and at check-in, the staff were super friendly. I requested a higher floor room and the front desk agent happily upgraded me. The area of the hotel has really improved. Hermes and Rolex are right across the street. Take a walk around and it feels like Soho used to. Also worth mentioning, I tried the new sushi bar on the rooftop, incredible food (and the view is even better)! Overall just a really nice place to be. Will visit again!

title: Gansevoort is back
text: I hadn’t been to nyc in over a year. what a difference. Not only is the hotel Brand new, but the city feels alive.  the Meatpacking district is amazing. Little island (this new park pier) is so cool. Ask for a room with a view of it if available. The staff is attentive but not annoying. They were finishing another restaurant but i ate in the lobby café and the food was very good and bar was really luxurious. Drinks can be expensive but it’s nyc.

title: Home from home in NYC
text: This was my second two week stay at the Gansevoort in a year and I they can bank on my custom henceforth. The location is unrivaled, the staff are attentive, the food is superb (try the omakase on the roof).. The addition of the interactive workout Mirror in the rooms was an unexpected flourish this time. Thank you, team.

title: Perfect choice for a stay in NYC
text: My boyfriend and I had a great weekend in the Gansevoort Meatpacking. Our suite was just perfect and the rooftop was a highlight! Great bar and pool with awesome views. We had absolutely everything we needed so highly recommend a stay here! The district is great too, there’s so much going on, loads of fun bars and Chelsea market is cool too. All in it was a wonderful stay and we were very well taken care of.

title: There is NO WHERE better in the city to stay!
text: I had such a wonderful stay at the Gansevoort!! From check in to check out, everything was smoothless and pristine. John was so friendly, greeting us every time we came back from a beautiful day in the city. The hotel is so close to everything we need, my sorority sister alum friends and I had a great reunion staying here and visting Chelsea Market and the High Line. Make sure to check out their impeccable rooftop and don’t forget to order yourself an Ari Gold, they’re fantastic! Tell Evan, the sisters of Alpha Chi miss him dearly 😘😂

title: Best Hotel in NYC - Hands Down!
text: The Gansevoort Hotel has been my go-to for over 15 years.  The staff is always friendly & courteous and the hotel is immaculate.  I recently went to NYC and per usual, made my reservation at the Gansevoort Hotel.  When arrived I was floored by the renovations.  The entire front, outdoor seating, restaurant, lobby and the rooms have all been completely renovated.  The hotel is absolutely gorgeous, and is hands-down the nicest hotel in Manhattan.  Great job!  I cannot wait to come back.

title: Lovely Hotel
text:
Firstly the location is king, so convenient and close to soho and other great trendy areas that are in walking distance 
The hotel staff are always accommodating and friendly 
I loved the roof top pool with its spectacular 360 degree view of Manhattan , mesmerizing., I also enjoyed the sushi restaurant which is also on the roof.
I had a great stay and can’t wait to go back , 
Thank you to all the staff at the Gansevoort Hotel .

title: Exceptional Staycation
text: Exceptional service and amazing ambience and amenities. From the moment we checked in for our long weekend staycation, we felt well taken off and very much at home (including our fur son, Yogi). The updates (since our previous stays, pre-pandemic) were tasteful and elevated. The option to use The Mirror in our room was fun!  Breakfasts at Cocktails & Coffee were yummy, and so were the cocktails next door.  Roof deck, inspiring!  We love this place and its surroundings so much!  Looking forward to continuing our tradition of making this place our home away from home.

title: A pleasant surprise!
text: This was my first stay at the Gansevoort and it was a pleasant surprise!  The staff are friendly and welcoming.   It’s in a great location with many restaurants (try the RH Rooftop Restaurant), Lucid Design Studio and shopping nearby.  I had a business meeting on the Rooftop and the hotel catering for breakfast and lunch was excellent.  I had breakfast one morning in Coffee + Cocktails where the service and food was perfect.  I loved the hotel so much I extended my stay another night instead of moving across town.  I hope to visit again soon!

title: No air in winter/spring. Beware
text: Our room was so hat I called the front desk. They indicated that the hotel only has heat until the summer. Therefore, there is no way to cool down the rooms unless you want to open the windows and hear the noisy street and honking all night.  I told the desk that we would never have picked a hig end hotel that doesn’t have air, especially since it wasn’t disclosed. They said that’s just how it works in this hotel. Beware when you decide to stay here!

title: The highlight of our trip
text:
I have visited New York a lot and stayed at many hotels but our stay at this hotel will easily rank as my most memorable. 

Traveling with family and teenage/adult children of different ages can be challenging - particularly when the only thing they have in common is that they are all equally demanding. The hotel worked with us to find a great solution - a suite where we had 3 connected bedrooms/sleeping areas and 3 bathrooms ensuring everyone had their own personal space, excellent views and most miraculously their own bathroom to get us all out the door on the time. I cannot emphasise enough how helpful the hotel team was in finding the right solution for us on this trip. 

The location is fantastic - step out the door and you're in the heart of the Meatpacking District, surrounded by great shopping, restaurants and sightseeing. Inside the bedrooms are great - spacious, fantastic city views, extremely comfortable beds (you won't want to get out), and stylish bathrooms. They also have great luxurious touches like nice linens, fresh flowers, Loccitane toiletries and fitness mirrors. It is also surprising quiet to sleep with no street or city noise.

The public spaces are equally great. C&C restaurant on the ground floor was a great place to start the day with a really nice menu and good service. The rooftop restaurant and pool are really exceptional. Being able to take a swim in a heated pool overlooking all of Manhattan (in February!) is a really special experience.

Last but not least, I can't say enough good things about the staff. Anton the general manager and his team are consummate professionals. Nothing we asked for was too much and they were so genuinely helpful, warm and friendly at every turn - whether it was rearranging cancelled tours, booking restaurants, offering recommendations, helping with luggage or just ensuring our rooms were impeccable. 

Thank you for an exceptional stay. We will be back!

title: The service, the views, and location - pure perfection
text: The hotel itself is thoughtfully designed and well-appointed, with everything from Smart Workout Mirrors (in the rooms!) to rainfall shower heads in the bathroom and a Peloton bike in the gym. My room was quiet, despite the hotel being very busy, and the bed was to die for. It was very cold during my visit, but the rooftop bar was toasty warm with attentive staff. I loved watching the sunset over the Hudson River in the afternoons. The hotel is around the corner from Chelsea Market, the Highline, the new Little Island at Hudson River Park (not to be missed!), and the Whitney. Never mind all the other incredible restaurants and easy subway access. If all of that wasn’t enough, the service is nothing short of exceptional. The staff is friendly and so kind. In an era where services have been deprioritized due to staffing, it was refreshing to see how much attention the staff paid to their guests; it felt like home.

title: Excellent experience, unbeatable price.
text:
An excellent experience, all-around, at an unbeatable price. Very helpful and personable service. Our King Deluxe room was very comfortable (loved the bed, and our son’s pull-out was surprisingly luxurious). Auto-blinds opened to a beautiful view with great natural light. There was a Bluetooth speaker, smart TV, plentiful USB and electrical plugs, and nice hotel amenities from the pool to the L’Occitane shower minis.  Room does not have a microwave or hot-water thingy but the deli is like 3 mins away. 
C&C had good food and we enjoyed breakfast. Dining was no pricier than comparable options. 
Convenient location- nice neighborhood with plenty to do (shop, eat, museum, walk around, people-watch) and easy access to taxi or public transportation.
I can’t emphasize how wonderful the staff was- Robin and Karen took care of us at the front desk, and Raul and Gem took perfect care of our luggage and valet service. If you’re driving, get valet service. It’s worth it.

title: Great hotel and location.
text: Loved the rooms which were clean, ample and beautifully designed. Great friendly staff. Superb coffee, lunch and cocktails at the coffee and cocktails bar.  Shout out to all the servers and bartenders there. Even the cold lemon tap water was great! Will definitely be back.

title: Anniversary trip to New York
text:
I have just returned from a 4 day trip to NYC to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. 

We were lucky to stay at the modern luxurious Gansevoort Hotel. Recently refurbished in 2021. 
This hotel is in a fabulous location in the trendy area of the MeatPacking district. 
A stones throw away from fabulous bars, restaurants, designer shops, Chelsea Market and a few steps away from the start of the Highline. 
I absolutely loved the location and would definitely come back to this area again. 

The hotel itself will not disappoint. 
We had a beautiful double room with separate lounge area. Everything in the room was modern and luxurious. 
As a woman I was impressed that the hairdryer and hair straighteners were of a good quality standard. 

The staff in the hotel were super friendly and could not do enough for you. 
The hotel has an incredible rooftop bar and swimming pool with views of the Hudson River. Also on the rooftop is a fabulous sushi restaurant called Saishin. 

They also have a American Bistro restaurant on the ground floor called the Chester which offers drinks at their bar, lunch and dinner. Food was delicious. 

If you have been to New York before and been to ‘old’ Manhattan hotels….I definitely recommend a change. Get down to the Meatpacking district and stay at the trendy Gansevoort hotel. It’s fabulous and I will definitely return.

title: Great property
text: Gansevoort NYC has been the "place to be" for a long time now, and with their recent renovation, they will continue their reign. I had a great experience there, stayed in the Manhattan Suite, it was magnificent!!!

title: Christmas at the Ganswvoort
text:
We spent 7 nights of Christmas at this impeccably renovated Hotel. The warmest welcome from General Manager Anton and the Banksy in the lobby set the tone - and the rest of the hotel did not disappoint! 

We had stunning views from our spacious rooms with balconies which were connected by a living area.  This made for a very harmonious family trip.  The beds, linen and robes were pure luxury after a long day sightseeing. The technology in the rooms and the perfectly equipped gym were not lost on our teenage sons.

Enough cannot be said about the location..the nearby Highline is stunning by day and night. This walk never got old. There is a real neighbourhood feel with so much to do. We all loved the restaurants, and fabulous shops. Chelsea Market was a highlight and the golfers had a great time at the very impressive driving range at Chelsea Piers.

Christmas Eve was spent at the exquisite Saishin Japanese restaurant on the top floor with panoramic views of the twinkling lights of Manhattan. We had the 12 course Omakase sushi which can only be experienced to be believed. 15 courses next time as we did not want it to end. Christmas morning started with a rooftop swim followed by a beautiful breakfast downstairs. A 5 minute cab ride to Madison Square Garden for a Knicks game made for a very different Christmas Day.

Anton and his team are doing stellar work here.  We were made feel very special and will never forget our Christmas at the Gansvevoort Meatpaking.  We will back!

title: Great stay and fantastic location
text: We stayed here five nights with five people and I can only recommend this place. Location is fantastic just next to the Highline and Chelsea Market and with great views over the Hudson. We had booked 3 rooms through booking and the rooms and beds were quit small for 2 people. So we asked if we could get a different room, and the hotel offered us a great upgrade (one room with two beds and one room with a double bed) for 50 dollars a night per room. our room had also more space, an extra sofa and a great view over the Hudson. Rooms are recently renovated, clean and very nicely equipped. After three days we decided to extend our stay with two more nights and this was handled very well by the reservations manager (we kept the special booking rate and the same room). Nice roof terrace, friendly staff and a gym. Very good restaurants in the neighbourhood, 5 minutes walk to Greenwich Village, 15 minutes walk to Soho. Will definitely come back.

title: Perfectly situated
text: This place is THE SPOT. Best rooms, amenities, vibe, staff, neighbourhood. Tonnes going on, access to everywhere, epic views of The Hudson, the Japanese omakase restaurant on the roof was the best expression fo this cuisine I've ever tasted. Sake pairing too. I'll stay here every NY visit, ad infinitum.

title: Chris
text: I recently stayed at this hotel and was amazed with the reception from staff, especially from a gentleman  called John when I first arrived. The rooms were exceptionally clean and were updated in terms of technology. I was impressed with the Mirror gym equipment in my room which allowed me to work out first thing in the morning. I enjoyed my stay at the hotel!

title: No sleep possible because continuous high frequency noise by air conditioning all nighr long
text:
In a ‘king superior room’ on the 12 floor with a northeast view (#1203) at a rate of mote than $700 per night, the air conditioning, despite being turned off, continues emitting a continuos high frequecy sound non stop keeping you awake all night, preventing skeep. Serious housekeeping should have identified the problem prior to making the room available. We called the front desk who proposed to sent a technician who never showed up. After a second call one hour later, a technician came by , confirmed the high frequency noise problem but could not and could not solve it. The front desk daid they could not offer another room because the hotel is said to be full.

On a side note, the music a of the bar at the 14th floor can still be heard at the 12th floor, but the nuisance is very minor in comparison to the air conditioning noise.

The room refurbishment, compared with our stay 5 years ago is a plus and nicely done, although superficially performed in the bathroom. There is no central command for managing the lights, especially for turning off the night light in the bathroom which cannot be turned off and jeeps slightly illuminating the room. Eye shades are a must.

So , still nicely situated hotel in the meat packing district, nice rooms, but technology of air conditioning and lighting ruin the experience at more than 700 dollars per night.

title: Top notch service!
text: I had a wonderful experience at this hotel!  The staff was tremendous.  Diego, in particular, was especially helpful.  My room was very comfortable and quiet.  The rooftop restaurant/bar that overlooks the Hudson River and Little Island was terrific.  The location is perfect, with access to many restaurants and various sights.  The downtown vibe is great, and it's also easy to reach other parts of the city.

title: Amazing Customer Service
text: I want to applaud the amazing customer service offered by Diego Castaneda (front desk lead).  He went above and beyond to ensure my room request was made possible.  I arrived in NY for a business trip, flights were delayed and my original hotel was distant from my other team members.  With that said, I approached Diego for assistance with booking a room at Gansevoort knowing there was a low chance of it working out as I was a walk in (no reservation), systems were closed, etc.  He was both professional and creative in making everything work and helping me secure a room tonight.  His genuine effort and accommodating approach offered one of the best hotel experiences I’ve had and I want to say THANK YOU!

title: Dirty
text: There was a dirty sock in our room upon arrival. The caulking is dirty in the bathroom. Instead of taking the time to completely hide all electric cables, they’ve just let them be visible. Patches of this and that here and there. Toilet handle broken. Instead of investing in fixing things properly, they have invested in mirrors with a personal workout and yoga mats. Party on our hall. We were miserable in this hotel. Great location. Stay somewhere else in this location and you’ll be happy you spent your well earned money there.

title: Great place to stay for a nice weekend.
text: The hotel was unbelievable and was the perfect place to stay while in town for the Orphaned Starfish Foundation Gala. The staff was very helpful, the food, at both the cafe and restaurant, was delicious and the rooftop had a beautiful view as you had a late night drink. The location was also great, as it was a short walk from several restaurants and Washington Square Park. Always look forward to my yearly stay and already cannot wait for next year.

title: Amazing Stay - Love the Renovation
text: The Gansevoort has just underwent an absolutely amazing renovation and it provided us the perfect stay in New York City.  Every aspect of this hotel was just perfect, from the room decorations and functionality, the beautiful vibe throughout the hotel and the wonderful food and beverage offerings throughout the property.  But it was the service that makes this hotel completely stand out - from check in to check out, every team member at the hotel was so very welcoming, helpful and warm.  Thank you for this five day perfect stay in NYC and this will be the only property we ever stay here.

title: Two Recent Stays
text: Terrific experience-stayed twice, once with my college age daughter and then with my wife. Each stay was great. Rooms were comfortable; upgraded last stay with a suite with an amazing view and common room. Pool and pop up sushi were awesome Front office manager Laura was so kind when a last minute emergency left a change in plans she could not have been more helpful. Cannot wait to return

title: Great place to have a celebration
text:
I booked a 2 bedroom suite and planned a birthday weekend with friends from out of state. I was surprised by how helpful the hotel was in finding the best rooms etc.  
the rooftop pool is really an amazing site for anyone!  It’s a getaway from the hustle bustle of the city. The rooftop bar gets a little crazy but it’s fun to give it a try and the views are great.  The hotel is in a great location so during the day there are lots of places close by.  I will be back.  I recommend they put coffee makers in the rooms.  That had to be requested and for that caliber of a hotel, it should be included.

title: Best hotel in NYC
text:
Hotel Gansevoort Meatpacking has undergone an outstanding, extensive renovation and provides the ultimate guest experience in every way. I stayed in NYC on business and the hotel surpassed every expectation. My guest room was exquisitely appointed; from the bed sheets, the electric shades that uncovered a jaw dropping view of the River to the spacious bathroom with perfect lighting. Let’s not forget the Occitane amenities which are simply delicious.
And for those looking to throw in a workout, no need to leave your room as the Mirror offers a range of exercises if you do not care to work out in the 24/7 full gym with boxing bag & gloves.
And let’s not forgot the roof top with 360 views on Manhattan, where you can lounge or enjoy laps.

Truly an amazing hotel and one worth every accolade. Congratulations and many thanks to Anton, the General Manager, Luciana, Director of Leisure Sales and the entire team for making my stay so wonderful.

title: Great mini vacation
text: I have always wanted to stay at the Gansevoort, and it didn’t disappoint. The manager David was so helpful in helping us find some late night places to go for our last night.  Me and my wife are night owls and the Gansevoort didn’t disappoint with their overnight staff. The rooms were nice and my wife loved the robes. I will definitely stay again.

title: Perfect downtown NYC escapism ...
text: If you're looking for the ultimate NYC weekend getaway in these crazy times, this is the ONLY place you need to consider. Awesome rooms, wicked rooftop bar with a pool and a pop up sushi restaurant that gives Zuma and Nobu a run for their money.

title: Great brithday weekend
text:
It was my wife's birthday this past weekend and the forecast was for it to be super hot outside so I wanted to surprise her with a staycation at a hotel with an outdoor pool. Anton (the GM), Robin, and their team were awesome and super accommodating in making it a special weekend. 

They were able to get us early check-in for the suite, put the flowers I had delivered to the front desk in the suite before check-in, along with a nice note from the team and welcome desserts. They also had pool-side seats reserved for us. Overall great experience and I would definitely recommend it. Also, the renovations to the lobby, rooms, etc. are really nice.

title: Gansevoort Gold
text:
The newly renovated Gansevoort hotel is a real gem. Smack bang in the middle of New York’s Meatpacking district, it offers everything to everyone. The staff were super friendly and accommodating- no request was too big or small. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable with luxurious bed linen and views of the district’s many beautiful roof gardens. 

There really is something for everyone to do in the ‘hood. From the stunning new Little Island, to the Whitney Museum and the High Line. The area is also full of great restaurants including the Chelsea Markets. 

A highlight for our family was the wonderful rooftop pool where we had many refreshing swims after each days sightseeing. The atmosphere around the pool was very friendly and there is excellent poolside service provided. 

There are plenty of places to eat and hang out people watching in the hotel and the Japanese pop up Saishin is simply delicious and a stand out in Japanese cuisine. 

If you are an art lover, be sure not to miss the Banksy in the lobby and the many more beautiful paintings throughout the hotel. 

Anton Moore, the Irish General Manager has brought his hospitality flair to this establishment and he along with the staff make every guest feel special. We can’t wait to return.

title: Great customer service
text: The Gansevoort Hotel is in a perfect location. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. This was our first trip back since the craziness of last year. I was initially disappointed with the hotel as we had issues with the temperature in our room and also some plumbing issues. The hotel staff and particularly the managers, Melvin and Laura, were eager to resolve my problems and make sure I had a comfortable stay. I definitely felt like they were concerned about my comfort and that they went above and beyond to make things right for me. While I was disappointed with the problems, the thing I will remember most is the EXCELLENT customer service I received.

title: Great location, rooftop bar & pool
text:
The Gansevoort Hotel is in a fantastic location right in the middle of the Meatpacking district with lots of great restaurants and shops nearby. It’s a short walk to Chelsea Market,  the Highline, the West Side Highway Park and Little Island. The rooms are a reasonable size for NY city. The hotel just underwent an industrial modern renovation and is updated. The rooftop bar & pool have a great view of the Hudson River and the pool is a nice place to cool off on a hot day. 

The negatives are ridiculously low water pressure and bath products that smell like Pine Sol. I would recommend asking for a room on a higher floor to avoid hearing music from the street at night.

title: Best location, best team
text:
This hotel is brand new but the staff make it feel like they've been around forever.  The front desk team was so friendly (Diego and Erika!) and  made a real effort to make us feel special the entire stay.  Super attentive and effortlessly kind.

The neighborhood is perfect (easy walking distance the Highline, shopping, galleries and museums, great restaurants); the rooms are beautiful (we had a phenomenal view of the Hudson River); super comfy beds and nice linens; and fun technology in the rooms and throughout the hotel (great wireless, chargers, TV and movies, etc.).  There are multiple places to eat or grab a drink - each with a different feel so something for everyone (sports bar, cocktail lounge, cafe, etc.).  The pool is also great - a real treat to have an outdoor pool in NYC.

Maybe a small thing but the whole place smells incredible - the fragrance isn't too strong but is subtly beautiful.  This is a nice change from the rest of NYC in the summer  and immediately makes you feel relaxed coming off of a busy street.  There are lots of subtly wonderful things like this that make the hotel a stand-out, particularly as most of the other hotels in this neighborhood feel dated and a little tired - this reimagined Gansevoort is a wonderful addition.

title: Wonderful stay!
text: I moved out of NYC in 2020 (Covid) and have begun coming back regularly for work/life. Stayed at the Gansevoort last week for the first time and it was hands down my best hotel stay yet in New York. Clean, sleek room and amenities were all wonderful and the entire staff is exceptional (particularly the manager Anton, can't say enough about him). This will be my go-to place going forward. Thanks again! I'll be back soon :)

title: Amazing Oasis in The Right Place
text: From checking in, to seeing the views of the city from my two balconies, to spending many hours at the rooftop pool I had an amazing stay here. My trip was for pleasure and relaxation. All of this was achieved at the this property. The staff is very attentive, kind and experienced. The amenities are nice and clean. The location is perfect. You are a quick walk to a Starbucks reserve, Chelsea Market, The Highline and many of the best parts of the city.
